intro: Urginea mandalensis, commonly known as the Madagascar giant lily, is a striking plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom at night. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to its arid environment. Its bulbous stem is capable of producing multiple shoots, allowing it to propagate vegetatively. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is highly sought after in horticultural circles.
